title: Best Films 2017 Edition
author: Joe O'Brien
introduction:
We have been treated a truly terrific year of film, with a fantastic mix of blockbusters and indies.


Lorem ipsum  is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.

list.title: Love Simon
list.body: There's something that rings very true about Love Simon. Although we can't all specifically relate to being a gay teenager, it's easy to empathise with Simon as he progresses through the many ups and downs of High School. Well written characters and a likeable cast made this heartfelt dramedy into probably the best of its kind in 2018.

list.title: Widows
list.body: Steve McQueen shows that he has filmmaking range with the relentless heist thriller, Widows. From the outset it's dark, exciting and complex. Viola Davis leads a stellar, mostly female cast who give their all for their meticulous director. As the twists come quick and fast, it's proper edge-of-your-seat stuff. Sorry Ocean's 8, but this is how you make a heist movie.

list.title: A Star is Born
list.quote: All you gotta' do is trust me
list.body: With universal acclaim from critics and audiences alike, there's no denying Bradley Cooper's version of a classic film is deserving of high praise. Having been largely unproven in a serious dramatic role, Lady Gaga puts the debate on her acting abilities to rest, giving an emotional performance that will be long remembered alongside the movie's original soundtrack.

list.title: I-Tonya
list.body: Regardless of necessity for pinpoint accuracy in a biopic, the main responsibility of a film like I-Tonya is to entertain, and it absolutely does. Margot Robbie gets her meatiest role to date with Harding, and she gives it socks, portraying a damaged, hilarious and uncompromising character. It's utterly shocking and hilarious in equal measures, and never boring.

list.title: American Animals
list.quote: How can I tell you if I'm in or I'm out without telling me the first thing about what I might be in or out of?
list.body: It's a mystery why American Animals didn't get a wider release, as its an even better heist film than Widows. A young, up-and-coming cast including Evan Peters and Barry Keoghan inject an incredible amount of energy into this unbelievably true story about college students who decide to commit grand theft. Director Bart Layton turns the anxiety up to 10 with some of the year's most intense scenes. It's a hell of a cinema experience.

list.title: Avengers: Infinity War
list.quote: You're embarrassing me in front of the wizards
